alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 9:01AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING FOR THE INLAND EMPIRE AND COASTAL SLOPES OF THE SAN BERNARDINO MOUNTAINS... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Inland Empire and coastal slopes of the San Bernardino mountains in Riverside and San Bernardino counties. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated areas of moderate to locally heavy rain. Minor flooding has been reported in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area over the next few hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Riverside, San Bernardino, Fontana, Moreno Valley, Ontario, Corona, Rialto, Chino, Redlands and western Lake Elsinore. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
